div.p: Newton ISD is canceling school effective March 17, 2020 to aid in preventing the spread of COVID-19/Coronavirus. At the present time, there are no confirmed cases in Newton ISD. The district will reevaluate the situation on April 3, 2020.

div.h4: LIVE BINDER LINK: RESOURCES FOR PARENTS AND TEACHERS
div.p: The Region 5 Service Center has created a Live Binder with online resources for parents as well as teachers. Parents may go to the link and find the Parent Support Tab for resources for parents and students. There are also Tabs for Students with Disabilities and Dyslexia Support. \n\n

div.class: custom_42361 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

p.strong: This letter is to inform you that Newton ISD is canceling school effective March 17, 2020 to aid in preventing the spread of COVID-19/Coronavirus. At the present time, there are no confirmed cases in Newton ISD. The district will reevaluate the situation on April 3, 2020.
The district will begin a â€œflexible education programâ€ on Monday, March 23, 2020. The district will be mailing home instructional packets with review materials for students to have at homeâ€¦.

span.strong: UPDATE OF MEAL DELIVERY SERVICES
Â March 19, 2020
Dear Parents and Guardians,

Â We have made changes for our â€œgrab and go mealâ€ delivery which will begin on Monday, March 23rd . All bus routes will be utilized and meals will be delivered to your studentâ€™s normal bus stop or pick up location. All meal items for the week will be delivered on Monday. The student must be present to receive the meals. The buses will depart the campus at 11:00 a.m. and will begin their normal routes please be watching for the bus at where your student(s) normally get on the bus. Drivers will not be able to deliver the meal items to your doorstep. Students who do not normally ride a bus may pick up their meals at the Newton Elementary drive thru from 11:00 a.m. â€“ 1:00 p.m. the student must be present in order to receive the meal items.
Sincerely,
Michelle L. Barrow

div.class: img-responsive no-border col-md-4 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.strong: NEWTON ISD
Purpose of Plan:
To offer meals to children during school closure due to COVID-19.Â Â
USDA Waivers Requested by TDA:
Note:Â As of March 17, 2020, the requested waiver has been approved.

TDA has applied with the USDA for waivers that allow for school meal service during COVID-19 related closures that impact operations.Â The waivers allow for non-congregate meal service through the Summer Food Service Program (SFSP) and Seamless Summer option (SSO).Â
Newton ISD will begin distributing Grab-n-go type meals on Monday, March 23, 2020.

div.class: img-responsive no-border col-md-4 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.strong: Selected School Sites:
Newton Elementary School
Â Who may pick up meals:
Â Children up to age 18 may participate.
Breakfast â€“Free
Lunch â€“ Free
Meals must meet the USDA guidelines for federal reimbursement.Â This institution is an equal opportunity provider.
Option:
Meals will be offered Monday â€“ Friday, from 11:00 am to 1:00 NOON, at the selected site.

Newton ISD is planning to combine meals and give two meals at the Newton Elem. School drive thru, and deliver meals served as Grab-n-go, home based delivery.Â All students on a bus route will have their meals delivered to their designated bus stop.
Grab-n-go type meals will be prepared and packaged by CN staff and/or other district staff.Â Meals will include all required components.
Breakfast:
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Cereal OR Pop-tart OR Breakfast Bar
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Dried Fruit OR Applesauce
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Fruit Juice
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â White or Chocolate Milk
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Turkey, Ham and Cheese Sandwich
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Apple Slices OR Whole Fresh Fruit
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Fruit Cup OR Applesauce
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Baby Carrots OR Vegetable Juice
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â White OR Chocolate Milk
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Mayonnaise and mustard

div.class: img-responsive no-border col-md-4 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: Child Nutrition staff and/or other district staff will offer a curbside service.Â
Families should not enter the school building.
Signs will be posted for a specific location for meal pick up outside of the school building.
Parents will â€œdrive throughâ€ a specified location at each campus.
Parents who park their vehicle should walk to the specified area to pick up meals.

Ideally, CN staff will be scheduled to work preparing and packaging meals.Â This is due to the requirement of a Food Handlerâ€™s Certification for all food service workers in the state.Â Should there not be enough CN staff willing and able to work, CN will reach out to other district staff for assistance.
All available CN staff will be assigned to the Newton Elementary Campus.
Hours will be assigned by the Director of Student Nutrition.

strong.span: Because meal participation is an unknown, school feeding sites may be closed due to no or low participation.Â This will be determined on an as needed basis.

span.span: NEWTON ISD OFFER VS SERVE MENU IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE

div.class: custom_38459 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

strong.span: Bullying is not tolerated by Newton ISD.
Â Any parent or student who believes that a student has experienced bullying or has engaged in bullying is encouraged to report the incident immediately to the appropriate campus.
